00044 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LLITE
00045 #include "llite_internal.h"
00046 #include <linux/exportfs.h>
00047 
00048 __u32 get_uuid2int(const char *name, int len)
00049 {
00050         __u32 key0 = 0x12a3fe2d, key1 = 0x37abe8f9;
00051         while (len--) {
00052                 __u32 key = key1 + (key0 ^ (*name++ * 7152373));
00053                 if (key & 0x80000000) key -= 0x7fffffff;
00054                 key1 = key0;
00055                 key0 = key;
00056         }
00057         return (key0 << 1);
00058 }
00059 
00060 struct inode *search_inode_for_lustre(struct super_block *sb,
00061                                       const struct lu_fid *fid)
00062 {
00063         struct ll_sb_info     *sbi = ll_s2sbi(sb);
00064         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
00065         struct inode          *inode = NULL;
00066         int                   eadatalen = 0;
00067         unsigned long         hash = cl_fid_build_ino(fid,
00068                                                       ll_need_32bit_api(sbi));
00069         struct  md_op_data    *op_data;
00070         int                   rc;
00071         ENTRY;
00072 
00073         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "searching inode for:(%lu,"DFID")\n", hash, PFID(fid));
00074 
00075         inode = ilookup5(sb, hash, ll_test_inode_by_fid, (void *)fid);
00076         if (inode)
00077                 RETURN(inode);
00078 
00079         rc = ll_get_default_mdsize(sbi, &eadatalen);
00080         if (rc)
00081                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00082 
00083         /* Because inode is NULL, ll_prep_md_op_data can not
00084          * be used here. So we allocate op_data ourselves */
00085         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(op_data);
00086         if (op_data == NULL)
00087                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00088 
00089         op_data->op_fid1 = *fid;
00090         op_data->op_mode = eadatalen;
00091         op_data->op_valid = OBD_MD_FLEASIZE;
00092 
00093         /* mds_fid2dentry ignores f_type */
00094         rc = md_getattr(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, &req);
00095         OBD_FREE_PTR(op_data);
00096         if (rc) {
00097                 /* Suppress erroneous/confusing messages when NFS
00098                  * is out of sync and requests old data. */
00099                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "can't get object attrs, fid "DFID", rc %d\n",
00100                                 PFID(fid), rc);
00101                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00102         }
00103         rc = ll_prep_inode(&inode, req, sb, NULL);
00104         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00105         if (rc)
00106                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00107 
00108         RETURN(inode);
00109 }
00110 
00111 struct lustre_nfs_fid {
00112         struct lu_fid   lnf_child;
00113         struct lu_fid   lnf_parent;
00114 };
00115 
00116 static struct dentry *
00117 ll_iget_for_nfs(struct super_block *sb, struct lu_fid *fid, struct lu_fid *parent)
00118 {
00119         struct inode  *inode;
00120         struct dentry *result;
00121         ENTRY;
00122 
00123         if (!fid_is_sane(fid))
00124                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ESTALE));
00125 
00126         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Get dentry for fid: "DFID"\n", PFID(fid));
00127 
00128         inode = search_inode_for_lustre(sb, fid);
00129         if (IS_ERR(inode))
00130                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(PTR_ERR(inode)));
00131 
00132         if (is_bad_inode(inode)) {
00133                 /* we didn't find the right inode.. */
00134                 iput(inode);
00135                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ESTALE));
00136         }
00137 
00138         /* N.B. d_obtain_alias() drops inode ref on error */
00139         result = d_obtain_alias(inode);
00140 
00141         RETURN(result);
00142 }
00143 
00144 #ifndef FILEID_INVALID
00145 #define FILEID_INVALID 0xff
00146 #endif
00147 #ifndef FILEID_LUSTRE
00148 #define FILEID_LUSTRE  0x97
00149 #endif
00150 
00160 #ifndef HAVE_ENCODE_FH_PARENT
00161 static int ll_encode_fh(struct dentry *de, __u32 *fh, int *plen,
00162                         int connectable)
00163 {
00164         struct inode *inode = de->d_inode;
00165         struct inode *parent = de->d_parent->d_inode;
00166 #else
00167 static int ll_encode_fh(struct inode *inode, __u32 *fh, int *plen,
00168                         struct inode *parent)
00169 {
00170 #endif
00171         int fileid_len = sizeof(struct lustre_nfs_fid) / 4;
00172         struct lustre_nfs_fid *nfs_fid = (void *)fh;
00173         ENTRY;
00174 
00175         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: encoding for ("DFID") maxlen=%d minlen=%d\n",
00176                ll_get_fsname(inode->i_sb, NULL, 0),
00177                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), *plen, fileid_len);
00178 
00179         if (*plen < fileid_len) {
00180                 *plen = fileid_len;
00181                 RETURN(FILEID_INVALID);
00182         }
00183 
00184         nfs_fid->lnf_child = *ll_inode2fid(inode);
00185         if (parent != NULL)
00186                 nfs_fid->lnf_parent = *ll_inode2fid(parent);
00187         else
00188                 fid_zero(&nfs_fid->lnf_parent);
00189         *plen = fileid_len;
00190 
00191         RETURN(FILEID_LUSTRE);
00192 }

00194 static int
00195 #ifndef HAVE_FILLDIR_USE_CTX
00196 ll_nfs_get_name_filldir(void *cookie, const char *name, int namelen,
00197                         loff_t hash, u64 ino, unsigned type)
00198 {
00199         struct ll_getname_data *lgd = cookie;
00200 #else
00201 ll_nfs_get_name_filldir(struct dir_context *ctx, const char *name, int namelen,
00202                         loff_t hash, u64 ino, unsigned type)
00203 {
00204         struct ll_getname_data *lgd =
00205                 container_of(ctx, struct ll_getname_data, ctx);
00206 #endif /* HAVE_FILLDIR_USE_CTX */
00207         /* It is hack to access lde_fid for comparison with lgd_fid.
00208          * So the input 'name' must be part of the 'lu_dirent'. */
00209         struct lu_dirent *lde = container_of0(name, struct lu_dirent, lde_name);
00210         struct lu_fid fid;
00211 
00212         fid_le_to_cpu(&fid, &lde->lde_fid);
00213         if (lu_fid_eq(&fid, &lgd->lgd_fid)) {
00214                 memcpy(lgd->lgd_name, name, namelen);
00215                 lgd->lgd_name[namelen] = 0;
00216                 lgd->lgd_found = 1;
00217         }
00218         return lgd->lgd_found;
00219 }
00220 
00221 static int ll_get_name(struct dentry *dentry, char *name,
00222                        struct dentry *child)
00223 {
00224         struct inode *dir = dentry->d_inode;
00225         struct ll_getname_data lgd = {
00226                 .lgd_name       = name,
00227                 .lgd_fid        = ll_i2info(child->d_inode)->lli_fid,
00228 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
00229                 .ctx.actor      = ll_nfs_get_name_filldir,
00230 #endif
00231                 .lgd_found = 0,
00232         };
00233         struct md_op_data *op_data;
00234         __u64   pos = 0;
00235         int rc;
00236         ENTRY;
00237 
00238         if (!dir || !S_ISDIR(dir->i_mode))
00239                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTDIR);
00240 
00241         if (!dir->i_fop)
00242                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00243 
00244         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, dir, dir, NULL, 0, 0,
00245                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, dir);
00246         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
00247                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(op_data));
00248 
00249         op_data->op_max_pages = ll_i2sbi(dir)->ll_md_brw_pages;
00250         mutex_lock(&dir->i_mutex);
00251 #ifdef HAVE_DIR_CONTEXT
00252         rc = ll_dir_read(dir, &pos, op_data, &lgd.ctx);
00253 #else
00254         rc = ll_dir_read(dir, &pos, op_data, &lgd, ll_nfs_get_name_filldir);
00255 #endif
00256         mutex_unlock(&dir->i_mutex);
00257         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
00258         if (!rc && !lgd.lgd_found)
00259                 rc = -ENOENT;
00260         EXIT;
00261 out:
00262         return rc;
00263 }
00264 
00265 static struct dentry *ll_fh_to_dentry(struct super_block *sb, struct fid *fid,
00266                                       int fh_len, int fh_type)
00267 {
00268         struct lustre_nfs_fid *nfs_fid = (struct lustre_nfs_fid *)fid;
00269 
00270         if (fh_type != FILEID_LUSTRE)
00271                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EPROTO));
00272 
00273         RETURN(ll_iget_for_nfs(sb, &nfs_fid->lnf_child, &nfs_fid->lnf_parent));
00274 }
00275 
00276 static struct dentry *ll_fh_to_parent(struct super_block *sb, struct fid *fid,
00277                                       int fh_len, int fh_type)
00278 {
00279         struct lustre_nfs_fid *nfs_fid = (struct lustre_nfs_fid *)fid;
00280 
00281         if (fh_type != FILEID_LUSTRE)
00282                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EPROTO));
00283 
00284         RETURN(ll_iget_for_nfs(sb, &nfs_fid->lnf_parent, NULL));
00285 }
00286 
00287 int ll_dir_get_parent_fid(struct inode *dir, struct lu_fid *parent_fid)
00288 {
00289         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = NULL;
00290         struct ll_sb_info       *sbi;
00291         struct mdt_body         *body;
00292         static const char       dotdot[] = "..";
00293         struct md_op_data       *op_data;
00294         int                     rc;
00295         int                     lmmsize;
00296         ENTRY;
00297 
00298         LASSERT(dir && S_ISDIR(dir->i_mode));
00299 
00300         sbi = ll_s2sbi(dir->i_sb);
00301 
00302         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: getting parent for ("DFID")\n",
00303                ll_get_fsname(dir->i_sb, NULL, 0),
00304                PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)));
00305 
00306         rc = ll_get_default_mdsize(sbi, &lmmsize);
00307         if (rc != 0)
00308                 RETURN(rc);
00309 
00310         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, dir, NULL, dotdot,
00311                                      strlen(dotdot), lmmsize,
00312                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, NULL);
00313         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
00314                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
00315 
00316         rc = md_getattr_name(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, &req);
00317         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
00318         if (rc != 0) {
00319                 CERROR("%s: failure inode "DFID" get parent: rc = %d\n",
00320                        ll_get_fsname(dir->i_sb, NULL, 0),
00321                        PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), rc);
00322                 RETURN(rc);
00323         }
00324         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00325 
00326         /*
00327          * LU-3952: MDT may lost the FID of its parent, we should not crash
00328          * the NFS server, ll_iget_for_nfs() will handle the error.
00329          */
00330         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLID) {
00331                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "parent for "DFID" is "DFID"\n",
00332                        PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), PFID(&body->mbo_fid1));
00333                 *parent_fid = body->mbo_fid1;
00334         }
00335 
00336         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00337         RETURN(0);
00338 }
00339 
00340 static struct dentry *ll_get_parent(struct dentry *dchild)
00341 {
00342         struct lu_fid   parent_fid = { 0 };
00343         int             rc;
00344         struct dentry   *dentry;
00345         ENTRY;
00346 
00347         rc = ll_dir_get_parent_fid(dchild->d_inode, &parent_fid);
00348         if (rc != 0)
00349                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00350 
00351         dentry = ll_iget_for_nfs(dchild->d_inode->i_sb, &parent_fid, NULL);
00352 
00353         RETURN(dentry);
00354 }
00355 
00356 struct export_operations lustre_export_operations = {
00357        .get_parent = ll_get_parent,
00358        .encode_fh  = ll_encode_fh,
00359        .get_name   = ll_get_name,
00360         .fh_to_dentry = ll_fh_to_dentry,
00361         .fh_to_parent = ll_fh_to_parent,
00362 };
